{{Infobox Network Adapter |image1 = ALFA Network AWUS036NHR v1.jpg |image1_size = 100px |caption = High-Gain 2000mw 2W 802.11 B/G/N Wireless USB Network Adaptor |caption2 = |pp = http://www.alfa.com.tw/in/front/bin/ptdetail.phtml?Part=AWUS036NHR |sp = |dl = |wikidevi = ALFA_Network_AWUS036NHR_v1 |wikipedia = |brand = ALFA Network |model = AWUS036NHR |submodelappend = |subrevision = |submodel = |revision = v1 |model_part_num = |page_start_date = July 24, 2011 |page_start_origon = https://wikidevi.com/wiki/ALFA_Network_AWUS036NHR_v1 |sernum = |wlclass = N150 |series = |if = USB |if_bus_version = 2.0 |ifconnector = Female Mini-B |formfactor = corded (modular) adapter |vendor_id = 0bda |device_id = 817f |subvendor_id = |subdevice_id = |id_string = |windosid = |fcc_id = UQ2036NHR |icid = |boardid = |ecc_id = |oui = 00:C0:CA |chip1 = Realtek;RTL8188RU; |chip2 = |chip3 = |chip4 = |antconn = RP-SMA |antenna = |txchains = 1 |rxchains = 1 |sstreams = 1 |wirelessstand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |802.11n = 150 |802.11g = 54 |802.11b = 11 |wififreq = 2.4 |receive_sens = |transmit_power = |linuxdriv = |windriv = |is_manuf = No |manuf = Accton |manuf_model = |manuf_rev = |addchip = 2.4GHz Power Amplifier IC;Microsemi;LX5518;MSC, 5518, 109A;1; |flags = high power |802dot11_protocols = bgn |accessible_UART = No |accessible_JTAG = |category = |availability = |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 10/05/2011 |estreldate = 07/20/2011 |price = |upc = |ean = 4718050300853 |dx_sku = |newegg = 9SIA8UD3809133 |asin = B005ETA5K2 |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |country = Taiwan |powledcolor = |connactled = |spdledcolor = |leddupcolor = |dimmin = |weight = }}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== [https://deviwiki.com/files/datasheets/alfa_network/AWUS036NHR.pdf Datasheet] | [http://www.alfa.com.tw/in/front/bin/ptlist.phtml?Category=105397 Drivers] "P/N 14162020101BL000 REV R01" and a date code of '''1125''' is :silkscreened on the board of the v1 adapter pictured below. The FCC EUT also has the same text silkscreened on it.. but :[http://www.alfa.com.tw/products_show.php?pc=34&ps=8 '''ALFA''''s site seems to indicate that a AWUS036NHR v2 exists,
requires a different driver, and uses the '''UQ2036NHR''' FCC ID.] If [http://odessa.od.slando.ua/obyavlenie/novyy-2013-alfa-awus036nhr-v2-ne-peregoraet-ID7F5kp.html this one is a legit v2], the v2 PCB is much smaller, blue, :and using a [[Skyworks]] PAM (''SiGe'' 2576L). The LED on this device is '''blue'''. ==Links of Interest== ===Reviews=== *[http://www.wifi-turk.com/inceleme/12-alfa-awus036nhr-incelemesi-review/47-awus036nhr-tasarim-ve-donanimi/ On '''wifi-turk.com'''] ==Pictures==
